intro: Wahlenbergia clavatula, commonly known as the bluebell bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Wahlenbergia clavatula is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained conditions.
